gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮ੍ਰਿਗਰਾਜ ਤਨ ਜੰਬੁਕ ਅਧੀਨ ਹੋਤ ਖਗ ਪਤ ਸੁਤ ਜਾੲਿ ਜੁਹਾਰਤ ਕਾਗ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Mrigaraaj Tan Janbouk Adheen Hota , Khag Pat Sout Jaai Juhaarat Kaag Hai ?
translation: Just as a cub becomes subservient to a jackal or a Garud (Ardea argala) bows to a crow.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਰਾਹ ਕੇਤ ਬਸ ਗ੍ਹਿਨ ਮੈ ਸੁਰਿਤਰ ਸੋਭ ਨ ਅਰਕ ਬਨ ਰਵਿ ਸਸਿ ਲਾਗਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Raah Kayt Bas Grihan Mai Suritara , Sobh N Arak Ban Ravi Sasi Laagi Hai ?
translation: Just as Sun and Moon resides in the houses of Rahu and Ketu (the two unfriendly mythological demons), or Kalapbrichh the all giving tree of heavens does not fit into the jungle of Calotropis procera.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਕਾਮਧੇਨ ਸੁਤ ਸੂਕਰੀ ਸਥਨ ਪਾਨ ਅੈਰਾਪਤ ਸੁਤ ਗਰਧਬ ਅਗ੍ਰਭਾਗ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Kaamadhayn Sout Sookaree Sadan Paana , Airaapat Sout Garadhab Agrabhaag Hai ?
translation: Just as a calf of ever milk-yielding cow (Kamdhenu) sucks the teats of a she pig, or the young one of Airawat the elephant of god Inder keeps bowing before a donkey.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੁਤ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਿਹਫਲ ਜਨਮੁ ਜਿੳੁ ਬੰਸ ਮੈ ਬਜਾਗਿ ਹੈ ॥੪੭੭॥
transliteration: Taisay Gursikh Sout Aan Dayv Sayvak Hui , Nihadhal Janamu Jiu Bans Mai Bajaagi Hai ?477?
translation: Similarly, if son of a Guru's Sikh starts worshipping gods and goddesses, his human birth would be a failure just as a son of two fathers would be in a respectable family.  (477)
